name: Rory
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A great place for the more free spirit artistically inclined individual. A short bus ride from downtown Grand Rapids. Within walking distance of local restaurants, markets, even a dispensary if you swing that way. Just a couple blocks from Frosty Boy, a great ice cream stand.
It is smoking friendly, but an air purifier can be supplied. A fully kitted kitchen is wonderful for those who love to cook. A dedicated space just for art helps add a wonderful personality. the projector in the living room is a wonderful way to enjoy some Netflix or Spotify without your phone screen.
Jacob the host is a great guy. Making sure everything is going good without being too intrusive. Snacks and a coffee machine in the bedroom is such a nice little touch. The bathrooms are stocked with the basics and kept nice and tidy.
All that and it being more affordable for similar places makes The Space Cave an excellent stay.

name: Natalie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Last minute decided to go to Michigan for NYE for a concert and didn’t want to stay at some janky hotel for basically the same price so we decided to give this a try. And my boyfriend and I were so glad we stayed here. We have never stayed at a place like this, we usually have a hotel room or just rent out a whole house for ourselves, Only time I ever ran into other guests was during check out, which we both liked since we like our privacy. Everything was accurate from the listing, everything had a place. Whole house was clean, there were some delicious cookies Jacob left out which I definitely appreciated. Room was perfect for the night. The big selling point on booking this was that it was 420 friendly and that we were able to smoke comfortably, and didn’t have to go to the car and such. The location was perfect as it was only 10 ish minutes away from the music venue, which was super convenient. We honestly enjoyed it so much, I’m sure we’ll be booking again in the future!

,

Stayed over a week
review_text:
I loved this rental so much I extended it for another week. I can't say enough good things about the location of this spot. Restaurants, grocery stores, shopping, bars, CVS, all within 5-15 minutes away. The neighborhood is gorgeous and filled with historical homes. I would often walk around just to admire them.
The hosts (Jill and Tim) were amazing. They were so kind, helpful, and respectful of privacy. Clearly they have done some traveling themselves because the Airbnb has a handful of really cool maps!
This open concept studio is a great spot to stay in the GR area, especially if you're traveling alone. Clean, great AC, well stocked, and spacious. This spot is LGBTQ+ friendly, which is always a comfort to me when traveling.
Thank you, Jill and Tim!

For me, the perfect Airbnb stay.

name: Karen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2019
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
This Queen-bed studio basement apartment is extremely well-located, in the Eastown section of Grand Rapids, within walking distance of many tasty restaurants and a couple of local craft breweries. Also nearby is the beautiful historic Heritage Hill residential district, including the immaculately restored Frank Lloyd Wright designed house (for Meyer May). It’s also a short drive to downtown Grand Rapids, Founders Brewery, and the Gerald Ford Presidential museum.
Despite it being a basement apartment, it’s windows provide plenty of natural light and a great cross-breeze. Jill & Jim have made their space very cozy, including a comfortable bed and comfy leather armchair. This place is extremely clean & peaceful. Plus, they provided yogurts, granola, tea & coffee, which were welcome surprises for a quick breakfast to start our morning.

rating_info:

review_text: Jill and Tim have a lovely efficiency apartment in the basement on their historic home in East Town. We were surprised by just how walk able their location is. We've stayed in Grand Rapids 3 years in a row and they have the best location, as long as you aren't looking to walk right into downtown. They have delicious food and great breweries, cute shops and stores all near by. Plus their neighborhood is charming. The apartment was very clean, with plenty of extra pillows and towels available. Jill and Tim have the apartment filled with trinkets from the GR area, menus for their local eats and some snacks and tea if you can't quite get enough while you are out. Their cute apartment was a great place to cool our heels after walking around the city all day.

name: Linda
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: The home was exactly as pictured... beautiful and full of character with modern amenities. A nice comfy bed, convenient seating area in the room, thick fluffy towels, a hot shower and an enormous tub! The common areas were spotless and comfortable too. We stayed in the Grand Room which is in the front of the house so there was some traffic noise. It didn't disturb our sleep, but others may want to book one of the other rooms in the back of the house. As the pictures show, there aren't any window treatments over the windows above the bed, so be aware if you aren't ok with waking up with the sun. The parking and driveway is tight but works, the comfort of the home more than makes up for it. The Heritage Hill area is beautiful. Be sure to tour the Mayer May House, but the free tickets go fast! We did the Pleasant Little Walk by Pleasant Park and viewed many beautiful homes. We would stay with Skyelar again!

name: Cynthia
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Super impressed with this gorgeous Airbnb stay! The home itself is impressive, and Skyelar and family have chosen to open much of it to their guests. A large seating area, dining area, and a cute sunroom with a few amenities like toaster, micro, and fridge are open to guests. The grand room we stayed in was HUGE with seating for reading, desk space, a large tv, wardrobe for storage, and super comfortable king bed. The bathroom, equally as impressive, had a large original tub, glass shower, and was so roomy. Skyelar left snacks near the Keurig too. Location was perfect for walking to downtown or among the Heritage Hill neighborhood to check out the beautiful historic homes. Just a comfortable and fun place to stay!

The room was immaculate, so spacious, and we loved the relaxing bathtub. The common areas are gorgeous, bright, and super tall ceilings. The beds were so comfortable. Snacks, cold water, and coffee provided. We can’t say enough. Well worth the price we paid and a great location off the beaten path but close to walk to everything downtown. Make sure to check out Beacon for dinner when you are in the area. It was PHENOMENAL.

review_text: We had an event in down town GR and I was looking for a place to stay that was in walking distance. I found this listing and contacted Skyelar, who was very helpful and accommodating! There happened to be a big storm that night and sirens went off while we were out to dinner. Skyelar immediately texted and called to check on us to make sure we were in a safe place, not knowing if we were on the property or not. We were, but I was very thankful that our host checked in on us. The Heritage Hill neighborhood is beautiful and we felt safe walking home. Overall we had a great experience.

Gorgeous old mansion in Heritage Hill. Just make sure you know what color the house is so you can find it easily. There is a privacy hedge to the main road that can make finding the house a challenge, but is nice to have when you know where to go.
Room was comfortable, private, large and had a good bed.
Host was very responsive and easy to work with.
We found the location very central to our needs. We could walk to the water front and to restaurants in the downtown area, but had extremely easy highway access, and didn't feel like we were stuck going downtown.
Would recommend.

Another super plus to this home is the private parking, what a stress reliever knowing your car will remain safe as you go about your day on foot (as it is located within walking distance from Downtown GR) or grabbing a quick Lyft after a long day of fun! I highly recommend staying at this gem, you will not be disappointed!!!

The sun room was a highlight because of my love of plants. Communication with Skyelar was great. If I ever have need to return to the area, I would again consider booking here. This was a great experience.

review_text: Lovely historic home with only a few guest rooms but a huge elegant living room, dining room and sunroom with snacks for you to enjoy. The pictures do not do the "Grand Room" justice because the room was so much bigger and prettier in real life, more like a suite with tons of built in closet storage and a unique antique bathtub. Walkable to downtown businesses, funky Eastown and gourmet paradise Martha's Vineyard, this spot is convenient in all directions. The driveway parking is pretty tight but it works if everyone follows the instructions on how to pull in at an angle, and based on this walkable location, you may just leave your car there anyway. Very responsive and friendly host.

Our stay here at Drumlin was truly five stars all around! Can not say enough good things about this place. As frequent Airbnb'ers, this was hands down the best Airbnb we've ever stayed in around the world. We booked both the Drumlin and Lehigh for a larger space and the space worked great to move between both.
The location is centrally located with plenty of on-street parking. Upon arriving, we were greeted with a beautiful welcome basket complete with snacks and a very detailed guide to the home and neighborhood. The place is spacious and meticulously designed with modern, clean finishes. Our stay was truly top notch.
Kelly & Jeff were also great to work with and strong communicators. Flexible and easy to work with, very friendly and accommodating.
We can't recommend this stay enough!

name: Shelbey
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay at the Drumlin Suite went beyond our expectations. I already knew that the home would be beautiful but every detail was something to look at. I planned a surprise trip to Grand Rapids for my boyfriends birthday and had mentioned this to Kelly & Jeff. They were so accommodating and sweet to use the décor that I had sent and hang it prior to our arrival. I was blown away at how well decorated the house was and my boyfriend felt very special too. They even had a card and a 6pack of local brewed beer with his name on it. That was a thoughtful touch! Communication with Kelly and Jeff was always quick. I had some questions about where to order a cake and they recommended a few local bakeries. I ordered the cupcakes and Kelly & Jeff offered to pick them up and have them in the suite before we arrived. That saved me so much time and the worry on having to get them without Mike finding out. The keypad entry eased our mind, the readily available amenities, the comfortable beds and extra pillows/blankets were a great perk. The Drumlin Suite had a hotel feel and nothing was lacking. We even forgot to bring shampoo but have no fear because each of the bathrooms had a stocked shower with Shampoo, Conditioner and Body wash. The location of the Suite was also great! Walking distance to most of the downtown restaurants, breweries and bars was awesome. Even being on the main road, the home was well insulated and we could not hear any traffic or city noise. I really cant say enough good things about these hosts and the homes that they provide. My boyfriend and I were very impressed and so happy that we could spend a special weekend at such a beautiful home. It was everything that we were looking for and we will definitely recommend it to our family and friends. Thank you Kelly & Jeff for all that you did. You really outdid yourself! We will definitely be back!
Shelbey & Mike

Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
To Austin, or anyone reading this considering a stay here in Grand Rapids…DO IT!
Seeing the place on the app was one thing (amazing), but being there was an EXPERIENCE! Austin has designed the comfiest, and coziest place I’ve ever stayed.
The apartment felt catered to me, being a musician myself. I was in awe at his book collection, and having a piano on hand (get it?) helped keep me active, even while on vacation!
Location wise, it was just perfect. Located on a quiet, safe residential street, yet 5-8 minute walking distance from all the action of the city! Anything I needed that I forgot to pack was JUST down the road and I loved that convenience.
Austin was also the first renter that has been so attentive to any needs/questions/concerns I had. From before I even left Boston, Austin had reached out and I never felt alone while adventuring around. Truly wish we could’ve met, but perhaps another vacation?
Austin, thank you, thank you, THANK YOU for all of your help and opening your home to me and mine :)

You're staying within her "home" not at some converted room or garage. You'll love walking up the stairs to your very private room with its own bathroom and amenities. The whole thing reminded me of what AirBnB used to be like in the past. People opening up their homes for you to enjoy and have a real local experience. My visit to Grand Rapids related to a family emergency with Catherine's home being just a few minutes to the Children's Hospital. Everything is close and there are a lot of great restaurants nearby. Next time that I'm back in Grand Rapids I will not hesitate to seek for another stay here.

Catherine has hosted us twice. She is very attentive, communicates proactively and has a wonderful historic home within the historic Heritage Hill district of Grand Rapids. Her home is perfectly located walking to local trendy neighborhood local restaurants; a Frank Lloyd Wright home (the Meyer May house) and also walking or a short uber/bus ride to downtown.
You can get all the best the central area of GRR has to offer while stepping away to a peaceful and quiet spot. Her room is perfect size for individual or couple traveling, the bathroom super clean, great amenities (in room cofee, TV, wifi, toiletries) and a lush tile bath with shower, tub and a heater for those who love pampering themselves.
Like the first time, we would definitively come back to Catherine's

review_text:
Historic, magnificent, close enough to everything but quiet, top it off with a wonderful host!
Catherine's place is in the historic Heritage Hills neighborhood, few steps away from Frank Lloyd Wright's Meyer May House and President Gerald Ford's boyhood home. The house is ample, clean and wonderfully appointed. The porche allows for a relaxing evening and it is only a few steps away from the Wealthy St. trendy establishments or a 20 min walk to downtown's venues. Her street is quiet, easy to access and packed with historical residences. Parking was easy and hassle free - unlike hotels, no need to park in a ramp, deal with charges and having to drag luggage around.
We stayed while in town for a Broadway show and definitively would do it again.
Catherine was very communicative, provided us with accurate information and was there to give us a warm welcome and help us with pointers about our stay.
Better than many other spaces in the area and certainly beats a hotel stay.

We loved our overnight stay at Catherine's beautiful, historic home. The Heritage Neighborhood is an architecture lovers dream and exciting to discover!
Catherine's communication was excellent. She was timely, offered clear instructions, and was flexible with our check in time. She invited us into her beautiful living room, and we enjoyed talking with her and another guest.
The bedroom and bathroom were roomy, very clean, and had everything we needed. The king bed and linens were very comfortable. The weather was dreary, cold and damp, but this home is warm, beautiful, and cheerful.
We highly recommend Catherine's home. For all the above reasons it is an excellent value. We will be happy to return there on our next trip to Grand Rapids.

rating_info:

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Catherine's place is beautiful! Her place is in the heart of Hertiage Hill, a community of historical homes. There are restaurants and shops within walking distance. We visited in December when it was very cold and after they had a huge snow storm. Her driveway, pathways, and steps were well cleared and salted. The room was as described and had a very comfortable bed and nice shower. The room was cozy and warm. There were space heaters in both the bedroom and bathroom. The room was spacious and had a chair and bench to sit on as well as a large chest of drawers for clothes. We visited around Christmas time and her place was well decorated inside and out. Catherine's place is an extremely good fine in heart of Grand Rapids. She is very welcoming and responsive. Check in and out was easy. Her place is a gem. I hope we are luckily enough to book this place next time we visit.

review_text:
We were in Grand Rapids for a wedding and arrived late to Catherine's place. I thought I'd sent her my eta. Even though she hadn't received it, she was gracious and welcoming when we arrived after 8 p.m.
The room was wonderfully comfortable and lovely. The bed is luxurious, the room is quite private, and the bathroom is roomy and well-equipped We appreciated the cold bottles of water since it was one of the hottest days in Michigan history, as was the day of the wedding. The room, with adequate AC plus a ceiling fan and an oscillating fan, was plenty cool for the hot days. We couldn't hear anyone else in the house, even though the family live there. Common rooms are gorgeously decorated, but we really stayed in our room or outside walking in the neighborhood or at our events. The room also has a little fridge, nice tv with lots of streaming services, K-cup with coffee & creamer, and a writing desk. Very cozy. The neighborhood is lovely. You can also walk to many restaurants and shops. A cultural experience! You'll love it!

name: Simone
rating_info:
Rating, 1 star
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The location is great and the home has the typical historical charm featured in Heritage Hills. Grand Rapids has limits on short term rentals and we are VERY familiar with them. That being said, it should be noted that Catherine does reside in the home AND her boyfriend was there overnights during our stay. We were the only guests as the city does not allow more than 2 guest per rental. Here are some things to consider when booking:
*Catherine’s bedroom is literally arms distance from the suite so there’s limited to no privacy. Waking up due to doors slamming, vacuuming etc just isn’t ideal accommodations.
*The suite was extremely warm when we arrived. Catherine made us aware that she didn’t turn on the AC until 4:30p (check in is at 4p) because she was on vacation and doesn’t like to leave it running when she isn’t home. It took a long time for the room to cool comfortably as we arrived around 830p.
*Guests DO NOT have access to control the AC and we woke up both mornings sweating as it was turned OFF
*After dropping off our luggage we went to grab food. Upon returning, the front door to the house had been chain BOLTED from the inside by Catherine. She said she doesn’t like to leave it unchained after a “certain time” which I found to be a passive aggressive way of telling us she isn’t comfortable with guests coming and going “late” hours. Mind you, it was hardly 1030pm. She stated didn’t know if we had checked in yet which was odd seeing that she has a security camera system AND we sent her a msg through the app at 8:26p letting her know we had just arrived.
*The door to the suite was inoperable at the time of our stay and we were told to enter and exit through the bathroom. There’s no way to lock the suite from the outside which presented a security and privacy issue.
*We kindly let her know the next evening we would be out really late and arriving back around 4am to attend an event because we didn’t want to be locked out the home. She then asked if we could not use the shower when we arrived back as the shower is “quite disruptive”. We weren’t comfortable with not showering however we felt like we didn’t have a choice as Catherine had already made the stay less than desirable by locking us out.
*The suite is not suited for relaxing and sleeping in as there are only staging shades on the windows making it extremely bright. Lights from passing vehicles on the street presented a sleep disruption at night. You can see straight through the bathroom windows as well from the outside as the very sheer window coverings presented little to no privacy so we found ourselves showering with the lights low or off.
We ended up cutting our stay a day earlier than planned and extending our time in the city some place else. Catherine was more concerned with us not giving her a bad review vs asking how she could make our stay more comfortable when I told her we were leaving. She later sent a msg in response to a partial refund request stating she was windowed and retired and needed the income. Well, we are fully retired and disabled veterans but that doesn’t change the fact that Catherine made our stay uncomfortable and inconvenient. She needs to include a more detailed written listing with her “rules, stipulations, and preferences” PRIOR to booking so guests have the OPTION to decide if this suits their needs. She later attempted to push blame and responsibility to us by telling us we should have selected accommodations more suited to our needs, which of course wasn’t the issue at all, and she never actually addressed the problems. My partner and I are both well into our 40s and didn’t like that we had to let the host know when we were coming in so we wouldn’t be locked out. Our stay felt more like a boarding school than a BnB.

This house is a renovated old soul home on a large lot in a rejuvenated area within a block of cobblestone street shops and restaurants. Stephanie's place is warm, relaxed, welcoming and well appointed, with unique historic charms. Her thoughtful provision of absolutely everything that might make our stay easier was noticed and very much appreciated. Would heartily recommend to all families staying in GR!!

Despite the fact that I ordinarily avoid guest houses and the like, I decided to give this listing a shot after reading the stellar reviews. I normally avoid listings like this because I value my privacy, but I felt comfortable booking it after reading reviews about how this tiny house provides a lot of privacy. I am very glad that I decided to do that because my wife and I could not be happier with our stay.
The tiny house is exactly as described. It is very obviously well-built, including the fixtures inside. It is an ideal size for two people. We did not feel cramped at all as the interior is surprisingly spacious. We are very satisfied with every element of our stay and will definitely check availability the next time we return to Grand Rapids.

name: Ryan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My fiancée and I had a weekend business trip to Grand Rapids. While we enjoy downtown GR, we were also hoping to be able to unwind a bit while we were away for the weekend. Amy's place was the perfect fit: only 15 minutes from Downtown, we were able to zip in and out of the city for the meetings that we had. But we were far enough away, in a quiet neighborhood, that we were able decompress, relax, and enjoy some much needed time away after our other obligations were done.
We've stayed in "tiny houses" before and found that people tend to take pictures in such a way that make the space look much larger than it actually is. Amy seems to have done the opposite: when we opened the door at check-in we were blown away by how big the place really was. Once the door shut behind us, the decor and size of the place made it feel like we were standing in a full sized studio apartment. And with a full kitchen, bathroom, washer/dryer, couch, and bed, the space had everything we needed.

review_text: The stay was amazing. This may seem minor, but the comforter they had for the bed was the most comfortable one I’ve ever used. They even had a Netflix account set up that we could use, I mean I have netflix anyway, but it was still a nice additional feature. The only issue we had is that there was no oven fan. It seems a little silly to have a stove/oven but no fan for it. The regular ac unit was across the room, so our smoke detector went off quite a few times while trying to cook because of the kitchen setup and the lack of an oven fan. The water pressure is also a little weak, but for a renovated pool house and for the price, it was absolutely amazing. I would definitely stay there again.

Parking in the street was very easy since we were there Friday after 5 pm and weekend. They only enforce paid parking mon-fri 8 am to 5 pm.
I would totally stay here again.

There is a small patio off the primary bedroom which would benefit from a small patio table and chair.The restaurants nearby are great.The best is Grove followed by Maru sushi.The Cherie Inn cafe, located directly under the apartment was just ok,not as nice as the website reviews of it suggest. It’s only open in the morning, so the noise was minimal.Parking on the street was good, apartment from Saturday night.

Max was super sweet and very easy to reach:) The airbnb itself was super cute and in an amazing location, there’s a breakfast place right underneath that’s amazing, best eggs benedict! Right next door there’s a crystal shop and across the street was a Kava shop, which, if you’ve never had it you have to try it. Overall was a great stay and would stay again!!!

name: Daniel
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend as a birthday get away for my wife. We live in Michigan so this was just a get- out-of-towner to visit Grand Rapids. This place is better than advertised! 2 things: accommodations and location! First, this is a completely, newly renovated Loft Style Condo. Wonderfully laid out with new everything. Add to this, the host has paid attention to detail, you really don't need to bring anything (except food and drink). Kitchen has coffee maker with coffee, dishes, towels, linen, washer/drier. Has wifi, a shuffle board, which we used, and Xbox which we did not use. And when it comes to food and drink, the loft is above a diner, across the street was a high end wine store, a tavern, a book store, a specialty coffee store, an ice cream shop, and multiple restaurants, etc. within 1-2 blocks! Plus, you are only a 6 min drive to the VanAndle Arena and other venues. We went to 3 nice restaurants in town and the Listening Room. Was an easy in and out of downtown. In my humble opinion, this place is a gem if you are looking to enjoy a cool area of Grand Rapids (East Town) with a smooth, light urban vibe. The only slight draw back is no dedicated parking (there is street parking) but we never had an issue finding a spot directly in front. The Host Max was great in ensuring we were comfortable in our stay. We definitely will be back.

Stayed one night
review_text:
This one's as simple as it gets. If you're coming to Grand Rapids, stay here.
End of story.
Purpose-rebuilt basement done up as one-BR one-bath unit. Main room combines full-function kitchen and living room. Bed is VERY comfortable full king (BOY did we appreciate the difference between king and queen this trip), living room area is comfortable, kitchen is ridiculously well stocked, shower is great and, again, bathroom is ridiculously well stocked.
You're also in the middle of the hippest neighborhood of a hip town, away (but close) from the downtown clutter, and with about 30 cool restaurants in walking distance.
The basement issue didn't affect our stay...minimal sounds from above.
Oh, and lest I forget...SPACE IN THE GARAGE.
One thing this trip did is bring home clearly the difference between AirB&Bers who see themselves as your HOST and those who see themselves as just property owners. Diana is a host. A lot of thought went into making this place perfect.
We'll be back.

The accommodations are exactly as pictured! Good thing because my first day in Grand Rapids it rained all day. I informed Diana that I would be staying in pretty much the entire first day and she quickly responded welcoming me as well as letting me know that there was a heater in the closet if needed as the temps dropped at night. The temp is the unit was perfect! Diana has the atmosphere at a perfect setting as there's constant airflow but it never got too cold. Even still, she offered to accommodate and change the temp if needed. No need, everything was just right!
I've stayed at my far share of AirBnB's but this one is easily on my top choices. I'll be going back to Grand Rapids in October and I'll for sure check to see if this unit is avail for those dates. Thanks Diana!

Diana sent several messages the day of providing us with updates as check-in approached. She even decorated the space since I had mentioned that we were coming up for my birthday. There was more than enough space for my husband and I. Plus all of the amenities that you could possibly need for longer than our two night stay. Motion sensor lights in the driveway/stairwell, as well as under the cabinets in the apartment, plus night lights in the bathroom and bedroom so it never felt like you were stumbling to find our way in the dark. Wealthy Street was within walking distance for plenty of restaurants, drinks, coffee and shops. Beautiful area, loved our visit!

review_text:
I only got to stay one night, (so far!), but I could not have been more pleased!
Firstly, the neighborhood is delightful! Peaceful & welcoming, yet near the city center and so many trendy restaurants and pubs/bars nearby.
That’s just geography though, what really matters to me is the host, and Diana is exactly what any traveler hopes for!
She was responsive prior to check-in, even accommodating a change in the time and if you’re the type who just wants to get in and out without meeting your host, the check-in process is straight forward and simple, yet secure.
The space is exactly as described, if anything she undersold it in the listing as she has gone above and beyond with the quality of things!
The bath towels were clean, high quality linens & plenty of them! Also, extra blankets, Bluetooth speaker, water pitcher with filter, & even an essential oils diffuser.
Don’t let the affordable price or downstairs location fool you, this space is top notch!
Bravo Diana!

Extra thought has gone into even the small details and decor
King bed sleeps like a dream

Host Diana is responsive, kind with sense of humor, very hospitable yet not visible unless needed; giving you that at home alone privacy
Garage available (back up skills required) plenty of street parking as well
Easy access to garage, front door and apartment door
Lighting entering the property and building, outstanding
Walking distance to fabulous eateries:
Outdoor Coffee w/attached Art Gallery
Greek Inspired Bar/Restaurant
American Fare Bar/Restaurant
Upscale Mexican
Authentic Bakery with Breakfast and Lunch offerings
Convenient to all Downtown establishments and withing 20-30 min. to near farmland towns.

name: Andrea
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
I stayed at the Broadway Bungalow for a little over a month.
Pros: Jonathan’s communication was excellent (I had a few minor issues/requests that Jonathan quickly responded to). The place is cute, and the kitchen is well stocked. There was always plenty of parking on the side street. A few top notch establishments nearby, only a 5-10 minute walk. I worked remotely, and loved the sit/stand desk. Internet speed was great! The shower always had hot water (though you have to let it run for a while to heat up).
Cons: The steps to get into the unit are really steep. The couch is a bit worn, and the place was pretty dusty in spots. They’re remodeling the first floor, so during the day it was noisy (but quiet in the evenings). When the temps were cold, the space was chilly. I imagine once the first floor is done/heated, it will help keep the unit warmer. The bed was a bit firm for my liking.
Overall, it was a decent place, and Jonathan’s communication was top notch.

Brian and Erica were extremely nice, they even accommodated our early check-in. They had wonderful recommendations and were always fast to respond to any questions we had. The location is AMAZING!! walking distance to anything you'll need. Although getting in, is a bit challenging. I do wish it would have been a bit more clean, and made more clear on the shared shower and it's size. It's quite small and the used bar of soap, and hair on the shower wall is definitely not what I expected. I also wasn't made aware that they have animals. Luckily I don't mind but someone else might 🙂 I would definitely suggest hiring a new housekeeper for the future. This is an absolutely beautiful home and I would recommend this to anyone looking for a home away from home. Again, Erica and Brian were both so dang nice. They also have great plant taste. That may have been my favorite part!
If you're thinking about staying here, do it! you won't regret it.

review_text: My husband and I stayed here for a much needed getaway from the stresses of life. I loved this condo! It was a fantastic way to enjoy city life for a weekend! Very cozy, lovely decor and an all around unique and eclectic Airbnb. The hosts were responsive, had thought of everything and made sure we didn’t have to really ask any questions with their thoughtful additions to the place. The loft with massive window was a fantastic way to enjoy an urban condo. I fell in love with the decor and feel of this renovated high school gymnasium. (I want the Frida Khalo bathroom mirror and hanging star lamp !) The bed was comfortable and tucked away in the loft away from the massive window to give you nice ambient morning light. The kitchen was huge with a massive amount of counter space and a beautiful Boos Block island! Barely noticed neighbors and enjoyed hearing the highway traffic for that wonderful white noise. Thank you for a great place to stay!

review_text: This is The Place to stay if you’re staying in Grand Rapids. The other glowing reviews do not exaggerate at all! Brian and Erica have rightfully earned their Superhost status. They were super friendly - from our initial inquiry, the booking process, to our virtual check-in and tour. We basically had the entire place to ourselves as the hosts were staying on their other property. My husband and I always love to stay in unique stays when we travel, and this truly was a one-of-a-kind. This stay felt like staying in a museum - the place is filled with artful, carefully curated pieces that weave a beautiful and cozy experience, from the floors that are original to the school’s gymnasium, to the original school furniture that the hosts purchased when the school was converted into living spaces. Our only qualm was we didn’t get as much time to truly enjoy all features the space had to feature (we only stayed a night); next time, we’ll definitely check out the rooftop pool! 10/10 stars

review_text: This is a three level condo in a building that was once a high school. The unit itself was part of the gynasium and has hard wood floors that you would see in a gymnasium. There are three floors to the condo. On the first floor is the fully stocked kitchen, a powder room, a living room and a patio. On the second floor is an office. On the third floor is another living room, a full bathroom with a small walkin shower, and the bedroom. There is a huge window that is as tall as two of the floors. The unit is decorated with Mexican art, Frida art, and folk art. The parking lot is across the street from the building. Just a five minute walk are restaurants and breweries.

name: Gresy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Some people describe their Airbnb as a gem and others don't. Brian and Erica's beautiful home is more than a gem. The fact that it is in an old high school building(Union HS) the charm just starts there and continues to their incredibly cozy home. They were more than "superhost" . Not only did they give us the entire place to ourselves, but gifted us with one of their local breweries as a welcome, along with a variety of snacks, coffees and water.
Their amazing home was so close (walking distance) to many places on Bridge Street, which offers two breweries, many restaurants and two museums: Butchers Union, One Bourbon, Holland Brewery and Atwater Brewery, The Ford Museum and The Public Museum which has a very cool carousel are a must to go to. Also, walking distance from their home was the Six Street Bridge which crosses you to the other side of the river where you will find: City Built Brewery (latin inspired cuisine), Field and Fire Cafe(great breakfast and the river view awesome), Linear Restaurant (fancy, great atmosphere) and other great restaurants as well as Look Out Park. (if you are willing to climb the 145 stairs) the view to downtown GR is worth the climb. "yes, I counted them!!!"
The Dash Bus-51 and 52 (which is free) will take you downtown where you can go to the Art Museum and explore what the downtown has to offer. David and I were blown away at how close their home was to so many places to visit and explore.
We went to GR, Michigan as I am on a quest to run all 50 states. Michigan was my 25th (halfway there.) We flew from NJ to GR, not knowing what to expect. It was an unforgettable experience and Brian and Erica's home made it happen, not only by their location to so many things but also, how comfortable and safe we felt in their home.
We would definitely love to stay at their lovely home, if we ever go back to explore some more of GR!!
Cheers,
Gresy Johnson and David Solin

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The space exceeded our expectations and we are excited to return! The location is walking distance to DT GR and anything you'd ever need - food, beer, coffee, grocery... It's a tri-level space with a large window that spans entire unit - be prepared for getting in your steps for the day ;). This old school building was repurposed very creatively and retained much of the original materials seen throughout the building/home (floor, steel beams, doors, etc.). There is a pool and game room that we didn't realize (likely missed it in the write up) but will take advantage next time! The bed and living space was comfortable and the beverages and snack were a very nice (and generous) touch! We ended up having the whole unit to ourselves because the owners were out of town - otherwise, this is an open/shared space so that could be an issue if you are wanting more privacy (they airbnb the 3rd floor - living space, bedroom, bath; the 2nd floor is their master bedroom and office space; the 1st floor is the kitchen, living room, bathroom, balcony). P.S. It seems they may be out of town often - building a another home. Also worth mentioning if you missed it - Brian & Erica donate back to those in need with each stay in their place - very generous and heartwarming to see good being done.

review_text: This unique rental was such a great place to stay! The location can't be beat - walking distance from some of the finest restaurants and breweries on popular Bridge Street in Grand Rapids. The unit itself is very clean, well appointed, lovingly & interestingly decorated, comfortable, quiet. The building is a converted historic high school. Apparently it has a pool and gym but I did not take advantage of those amenities. In all, this place has everything you need for a nice stay. The hosts are very accommodating and wonderful communicators (although they were out of town during my stay so I didn't see them). Would definitely recommend staying and would definitely go back.

name: Elizabeth
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If you are traveling to Grand Rapids, try your best to stay in Erica and Brian’s condo — it was incredible! You’ll be in a gorgeous three story condo with stunning floor-to-ceiling windows and warm, arty decorations. Their condo is in the building of an old high school, and there are some awesome features (like the original wooden gym floors) still in place. The condo is a work of art and slice of history, we felt so lucky to stay there.
Above all, Erica and Brian are incredibly warm, welcoming, and friendly. While we did not get the chance to meet Brian, we had the pleasure of meeting Erica, who is just fantastic. Everything you could ever ask for in a host—kind, friendly, great recommendations, and very responsive. She also clearly cares for, and is involved with, the Grand Rapids community. Finally, a note for LGBTQ+ travelers: I felt super safe and welcome here! I reached out to Erica and Brian beforehand, and they were super supportive and made it clear they are very welcoming of LGBTQ+ guests. Grand Rapids itself seems quite queer-friendly, too—I’ve never seen so many Pride flags in one city!
Thank you, Erica and Brian, for a truly amazing AirBnB stay, you are AirBnB at its best.

review_text: We have stayed at many air b and b's, This was our first disappointment. For starters we felt rushed during arrival, The listing shows kitchen, balcony and living room. Apon arrival it was made known we were not welcome in those areas. The loft was dirty( dirty sock, dust and film on surfaces and a dirty coffee pot) the floors were dirty the bathroom had no hand towel, wads of brown hair around the floor of the bed. The hottub was down (but we were understanding of the maintenance issues) The whole house stunk and we found a cigarette in the bedside stand. We were so dissapointed we booked for 2 days after waking up and being able to see we left after 12 hours and booked another air b&b. It has been dissapointing that they have not been cooperative in refunding the day that we did not stay, even with pictures of the issues. We hope this can be a learning experience and other other have a better experience than us.

Erica and Brian not only are the best hosts we’ve experienced upon staying in different spaces but they have the best location in Grand Rapids.
Their place is sensibly decorated with exquisite tast evoking culture, family and nature to start the stay on a great note. Their suite has several amenities (TV, coffee, snacks, hydration) ideal to relax, work or play. The rooftop boasts a great view of the skyline and the hot tub an ideal spot to enjoy a snowy Winter day or a sunny summer.
Conveniently located to both downtown and west end highlights, Brian and Erica have an extensive in-depth knowledge of the best spots to visit that only locals would master.
Definitely recommend their space and their hosting. It gets better with each stay!!

The building is SO COOL and the history maintained in the old school was really neat to check out. The rooftop pool was great on a hot summer day with beautiful views of downtown. They have a balcony off the pool for some very nice added privacy. I recommend hitting up the shuffleboard while you are there. Location was perfect - very close to New Holland Brewery and lots of great restaurants and bars. I highly recommend this place to everyone - you will not be disappointed. Just wish we could give it more stars! We will definitely stay there again if we are in the area.

The fans in the bedroom were helpful since I’m always hot, the view on the roof was awesome and the hot tub was perfect. I highly suggest anyone stay here if you’re in the GR area. Especially if you’re looking for a host who wants to show you around and have a good conversation with. (She’s also great at giving privacy if that’s how you prefer your trip). I hope to come back and visit sometime in the future.

Erica was seriously the nicest person ever and super hospitable, her living space was so unique and you could tell every little decoration was personal. She also had lots of local suggestions for us to try out and we enjoyed all of those we tried out.
We definitely plan on going back to GR in the summer and we hope to stay here again.
Oh btw the bed is super comfortable and they provide you with an Alexa which is also pretty dope.

With a walkable neighborhood and a location that’s just a short drive from everywhere, they truly are a perfect spot to stay in Grand Rapids!

review_text: Can't recommend this place highly enough! I was a little nervous going into it because we have never stayed at a rental that is a "shared space". But it totally surpassed my expectations! Amy and Bob have created a beautiful space in their basement with lots of lovely little touches to keep you comfortable. I loved their wall of books, the cozy blankets, the sound machine and heated blanket on the bed, and of course the delicious banana bread and snacks. Amy and Bob were very quick to communicate and really respected our privacy. Even though you need to walk a few steps outside your door to the bathroom in the basement, it really felt like the whole space was ours the whole time. Everything was really clean and beautifully decorated. Loved our stay!

name: Robin
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Amy and Bob’s place is located in a beautiful part of Grand Rapids Just minutes from the airport, downtown Grand Rapids, Woodland mall, and any restaurant you could imagine. The home is located in a safe neighborhood if you are a walker or a runner. Amy and Bob made it very easy to make a reservation and access the home. There are special touches including a small kitchenette with the ability to make coffee which was provided, along with bottled water and yummy homemade Christmas cookies and banana bread. The apartment-size refrigerator worked great for leftovers from restaurants. The home was exceptionally clean and quiet. The bed is slightly soft and a great sleep experience. Be sure to check out the restaurant sBistro Bella Vita or Butchers Union in Grand Rapids as well as Woodland Mall and Frederick Meijer Gardens-all are an easy Uber ride away if you don’t have a car. We will be back!
